What Are Dynamic Data Lists?

- Users can create custom lists online that can be tied to form submissions to model business processes

- If you know Sharepoint, they are like Microsoft SharePoint Lists

- The idea behind the lists is to allow end users to create simple applications without the need for custom development.

- Can also be "Excel Lite" for Portlets

 

Benefits:

- Editable

- Eliminates need for Java development

- Graphically define the information to gather (schema)

- Uses a graphical editor to build the workflow and apply it to the DDL

- You can define how to display the information in detailed and list views (templates)

- DDL items can be added to the Asset Publisher and filtered by permissions

- You can specify email or SMS based notifications

- You can embed velocity scripting in notifications to pull in data from the form, or use plain text

 

DDL Example Use Cases:

- Registration information for an event.  You create a simple form where users can input their data, then display the list of registrants on your website as they are submitted.

- Inventory management

- Vacation requests

- Sales order submissions.

- New Job Posts by HR

- To-Do Lists

- Office Pot Luck
